intro: Secamone punctulata var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf secamone, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments within humid forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies. The plant's unique morphology and habitat preferences contribute to its ecological significance in its native range.
